description: Implementation of a curfew as of April 2, 2020 between 8 p.m. and 6 a.m.
The Government is instituting a curfew from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. in the prefecture of Tchaoudjo where several cases of contamination by coronavirus have been detected in the town of Sokodé.
Total lifting of curfew and lifting of of all closure of towns concerned
President declares state of health emergency
Closure of all land borders of the country to passengers
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Suspension for two weeks from Friday, March 20, 2020 of all air routes from high-risk countries, namely: Italy, France, Spain and Germany;
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
All those suspected to have been infected with the coronavirus will be quarantined at the Lébénè Hotel (ex-Ibis/ Le Bénin). 

The government requisitioned the building for this purpose a little after announcing that all confirmed cases will be treated at CHR Lomé Commune.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As part of the management of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Togo, the Government has set up a short number 113, exclusively dedicated to the health monitoring of people who entered the national territory since March 2, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: the wearing of protective mask compulsory for all.
As Togo readies to resume flights, the government informed that all travelers must submit a certificate proving they tested negative to Covid-19 before embarking on flights.

The Government has launched https://voyage.gouv.tg a digital platform that allows travelers entering and leaving Togo, to carry out online, the immigration and health procedures necessary for travel safely.

The Government is launching TOGO SAFE, a mobile “contact-tracing” application to strengthen the contact tracing of a person tested positive for COVID-19 and better contain the spread of the virus in Togo .
Government releases 2 billion FCFA fro urgent actions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Head of State has decided that the CHR Lomé-Commune is dedicated solely to the treatment of infectious diseases
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Establishment of mobile laboratories for screening in the interior of the country.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: the national health insurance institute (INAM) and the Fund Supporting Youth-led Economic Initiatives (FAIEJ) inked a partnership agreement to train tailors and seamstresses so they make quality face masks amid the Covid-19 pandemic.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The closure of certain cities, in particular Lomé, Tsévié, Kpalimé and Sokodé, from Saturday March 21, 2020 at 6 a.m., with strict controls at the entrances to Tsévié on the national road N ° 1; from the toll of Aného on the national road N ° 2 and of Amoussou-Copé on the national road N ° 5.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: Creation of a special anti-pandemic force composed of 5,000 men.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: All sellers in the markets will have to wear protective masks
type_text: Sellers in market places are mandated to wear protective masks

description: The government has suspended, indefinitely, all recruitment processes in the public administration due to concerns about the hike of coronavirus cases in the country
Creation of a National Solidarity and Economic Recovery Fund of 400 billion CFA francs.
type_text: Creation of a National Solidarity and Economic Recovery Fund of 400 billion CFA francs.

description: Togo to supply its citizens with a three-month free supply of water and electricity as they move into Coronavirus curfew
type_text: Togo is providing free electricity and water for three months after it  declared a state of medical emergency

description: The Government is launching "Novissi", a cash transfer program to support the populations most affected by the measures taken as part of the national response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Togo.
type_text: The Government is launching "Novissi", a cash transfer program to support the populations most affected by the measures taken as part of the national response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Togo.

description: A $365,000 cash transfer fund will be set up in Togo for local micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) affected by the coronavirus pandemic
type_text: A $365,000 cash transfer fund will be set up in Togo for local micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) affected by the coronavirus pandemic
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Reinforcement of surveillance and of individual and collective prevention and protection measures: washing hands with soap, using hydro-alcoholic gel, not shaking hands when greeting each other, avoiding hugs and hugs, etc.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: compulsory self-isolation of 14 days for anyone arriving in Togo and having stayed in a high-risk country. In the event of non-compliance with self-isolation, strong sanctions are provided
